intro: Heterosmilax sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran arrowroot, is a climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are used as a starch source. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that are followed by spathaceous inflorescences. Its growth habit involves twining around supporting structures, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The botanical features of Heterosmilax sumatrensis make it an important species in both traditional medicine and local agriculture.
